article.headline: Massachusetts 78, Fordham 76
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. -- Ricky Harris scored on a jumper with 2.9 seconds left to lead Massachusetts to a 78-76 victory over Fordham on Wednesday night. Harris finished with 21 points and the Minutemen (7-7, 1-0 Atlantic 10 Conference) withstood Fordham's rally from a 13-point deficit. UMass led 76-71 with 50 seconds left, but Chris Gaston was fouled while hitting a layup to cut the lead to 76-73 with 40 seconds left. He missed the free throw attempt, but Khiry Gordon got the rebound and Brenton Butler hit a 3-pointer to tie the score at 76 with 36 seconds remaining. The Minutemen held for the final shot before Harris drove, pulled up at the free throw line and banked in a jumper. Anthony Gurley added 15 points for UMass. Butler led Fordham (2-11, 0-1), which has lost six straight, with 31 points. Gaston had 16 points and 14 rebounds and Lance Brown scored 11 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
